Author: rubiquity
Content: Poker applications output your hand history to text files, which can then be imported into poker tracking applications for analysis. You can also buy hand histories online in bulks of millions.

Author: ajonit
Content:
I have used password managers for more than 4 years now.

Here is how I work -

1. When life used to be simple, (read without smartphone and tabs) I just used desktop based Roboform (NOT cloud based) These days most of the companies promote cloud syncing of passwords, I am completely averse to storing passwords on cloud even if it means bit of discomfort.

2. Now for iPhone and iPad, I downloaded Dashlane, activated their syncing feature for few hours and synced my passwords on both the devices.

Author: briansmith
Content: FWIW, ~33% of all pages are loaded over HTTPS already in Firefox, according to the metrics collected by the browser. Author: dnautics
Content: I used to work in the lab adjacent to ken nealson... Another lab in the department was using this principle for waste water treatment. Stick electrodes in the water, draw current off of an enforced potential, and see what survives under this selective pressure. Turns out its a stable population that is fairly resistant to biotic and abiotic inputs... Just let the biology figure it out.  The output water is really clean, too.

Author: ajonit
Title: Ask HN: Little hacks that make your life easier?
Content:
Everyone has those own little workarounds that make life easier.

Here are a couple of mine -

1. Using AutoHotKey to write my signatures, frequently used expressions (ex: plm becomes "Please let me know if you need some more information." , answers to frequently asked queries by customers, open specific files with a keyboard shortcut)

2. Using IFTTT : This tool helps a lot. One of the ways I use it is to save my monthly utility bills (arriving in Gmail) automatically every month direct in my chartered accountant&

Author: mturmon
Content:
You are soft-pedaling this. There is much, much more on the SF-86 (http://www.opm.gov/forms/pdf_fill/sf86.pdf)

They have extensive sections on psychological health (e.g., have you seen anyone for a mental health issue in the last 7 years, if so who, and their contact information). There are extensive sections on criminal history and past employment, including reason for leaving, especially if it was Federal employment.

There are also sections on past friends, past addresses, and spouses and ex-spouses, and foreign contacts.
